comment.body:
That would only hold true in times of full employment, low paid low skilled jobs will get absorbed by automation. Even so the tax contribution of a low paid worker doesn't cover the cost of the welfare supporting the person who 'does not want to do that job'.
But worse that able migrant has left their community, leaving a capacity gap behind. Once many of the able bodied folks from a community leave, the community is left with children, infirm or elderly, and so the community the migrant left is impacted.
I think we need a big change in policy and attitudes, where we help bring all communities uptown a decent social and economic standard.
